//scripts.scss-*: Will embed source maps into the .css file to avoid a Sass source map removal detection bug. Commands fail if .sass files are used.
//scripts.scss-compile: Compile all .scss files (does so even if certain files are not touched). Maybe --update will allow this to be error-free soon: https://github.com/sass/sass/issues/4105
//scripts.asset:generate-pictures: Automatically generate downscaled DPI resolution images and link them to where they are used in the HTML. Might be better suited for Webpack.
//scripts.asset:*: Detect HTML and asset file creation/update/removal, and reflect the changes in ./public/. Used for asset filepath intelli-sense within /src/ SCSS and JS files.
//scripts.js:minify: Compress and mangle JS code. Implicitly uses terser's --toplevel (mangle non-global variable names) and strict mode (??) due to combination of --module with --compress (-c) | --mangle (-m).
//scripts.dev:watch: Runs both constituent commands in parallel thanks to the bash background operator, standard on MacOS, Linux, and Windows 11.
//scripts.browser:serve: In parallel, watch for /src/ changes, output changes to /public/, and provide a local webserver that refreshes the browser page when new output occurs.
//scripts.js:build-single: Lint, minify, and generate source maps for a single JS file.

scripts.dev:watch: npm run scss-watch  &  npm run assets:watch  &  npm run browser:serve
scripts.prod:build: npm run scss-compile  &&  npm run prod:js-build
